description: Resentment toward San Francisco’s tech workers has grown as many blame them for soaring housing prices and widening income disparities.
title: Technology Boom Breeds Hostility
title_page: Technology Boom Breeds Hostility - The New York Times
maintext:
Slide 1 of 9,
As the epicenter of the technology industry has moved north from Silicon Valley to San Francisco and the largesse from tech companies has flowed into the city, income disparities have widened sharply and housing prices have soared.
René Yañez held a sign during a protest against gentrification in the Mission on the Day of the Dead in San Francisco. Longtime residents of the Mission District complain that high-end apartments, upscale restaurants and exclusive boutiques are crowding out the bodegas, bookstores and Mexican bars.
